metadata.purpose: Document engine behavior anomalies, version regressions, and contextual insights for tournament analysis data interpretation

SlowMate_v0.0.0_DELTA.anomaly_explanation: High win rate likely due to playing against broken engines rather than actual strength. Performance inflated by opponents with serious bugs (timeouts, crashes, illegal moves).
SlowMate_v0.0.0_DELTA.context: This engine should be baseline worst performer - high ranking indicates data skew from broken opponent engines

SlowMate_v0.4.0_BETA.anomaly_explanation: Significant performance cliff indicating introduction of critical bugs in v0.4.x branch
SlowMate_v0.4.0_BETA.context: Marks potential breaking point where erroneous code was introduced

SlowMate_v0.4.02_Time_Revision.anomaly_explanation: Complete failure - likely timeout issues or move generation broken
SlowMate_v0.4.02_Time_Revision.context: Time management revision appears to have broken basic functionality

SlowMate_v0.5.0_BETA.anomaly_explanation: Cannot win games but draws frequently - suggests move generation works but evaluation/search is broken
SlowMate_v0.5.0_BETA.context: Latest version shows complete strategic failure while maintaining basic UCI compliance

SlowMate_v0.2.0_BETA.context: Appears to be the optimal version before major regressions
SlowMate_v0.2.0_BETA.recommendation: Consider this the stable release baseline

SlowMate_v0.1.x_series.context: Solid developmental versions with consistent tactical ability

v0.4.x_breaking_point.evidence: Sharp drop from v0.3.x (60%+ win rates) to v0.4.x (0-9% win rates)
v0.4.x_breaking_point.likely_cause: Critical bug introduction in major version transition

v0.3.x_decline.evidence: Gradual decline within v0.3.x series from 63% to 47% win rates

endgame_specialization_failure.expected: High decisive win rates due to endgame expertise
endgame_specialization_failure.analysis: Endgame-focused engines not leading in checkmate delivery suggests feature implementation issues or mislabeled builds
endgame_specialization_failure.recommendation: Investigate if endgame improvements actually implemented or if builds were mislabeled

tactical_intelligence_paradox.expected: Superior tactical play and checkmate finding
tactical_intelligence_paradox.actual: 19.0% decisive rate - lower than some basic versions
tactical_intelligence_paradox.analysis: Tactical intelligence improvements not reflected in decisive gameplay
tactical_intelligence_paradox.context: May indicate tactical evaluation works but mate-finding search is limited

time_management_contradiction.expected: Better time utilization leading to stronger play
time_management_contradiction.actual: Lower decisive rate (13.8%) than baseline versions
time_management_contradiction.analysis: Time management may have reduced search depth or tactical calculation time

opponent_strength_skew.implication: Tournament field includes many broken/non-functional engines
opponent_strength_skew.impact: Inflates performance metrics for minimally functional engines
opponent_strength_skew.recommendation: Filter results against known broken builds or weight by opponent quality

broken_engine_inflation.cause: High performance against completely broken engines (0% win rate opponents)
broken_engine_inflation.correction_needed: Normalize results excluding games against non-functional opponents

functional_builds.criteria: Win rate > 40%, some decisive wins, consistent performance

questionable_builds.criteria: Win rate 20-40%, inconsistent with version progression

broken_builds.criteria: Win rate < 20% or 0% with engine tester failures

primary_metrics.tournament_points: Main ranking metric - combines wins and draws
primary_metrics.win_rate: General performance but susceptible to opponent quality skew

data_filtering.exclude_broken_opponents: Remove games where opponent has 0% overall win rate
data_filtering.version_progression_view: Highlight regressions where newer versions underperform older ones
data_filtering.feature_effectiveness: Compare engines with similar names/features to expected performance

anomaly_highlighting.regression_alerts: Flag cases where version N+1 significantly underperforms version N
anomaly_highlighting.inflation_warnings: Mark high-performing engines that may benefit from broken opponents
anomaly_highlighting.feature_mismatches: Highlight engines whose performance contradicts their stated improvements

next_analysis_priorities: Identify exact version where SlowMate regression began
Analyze head-to-head records to find engines inflated by broken opponents
Cross-reference engine_tester UCI failures with tournament performance
Investigate if feature-named engines actually implement claimed improvements

version_regressions.analysis: Version 1.3.0 shows 10.4% win rate drop from previous version
Version 0.2.1 shows 13.8% win rate drop from previous version
Version 0.3.1 shows 14.7% win rate drop from previous version
Version 0.4.0 shows 54.4% win rate drop from previous version
Version 0.4.2 shows 8.8% win rate drop from previous version
Version 0.5.0 shows 50.0% win rate drop from previous version

feature_mismatches.expectation: should be superior at endgame checkmates
should be superior at endgame checkmates

data_quality_issues.analysis: Random-move engine has 70.7% win rate, likely inflated by broken opponents
data_quality_issues.recommendation: Filter games against 0% win rate opponents

data_quality_issues.analysis: Very early version achieving 70.7% win rate suggests opponent quality issues
Very early version achieving 70.7% win rate suggests opponent quality issues

key_insights: Found 6 version regressions across engine families
Identified 4 engines with performance not matching claimed features
Detected 3 data quality issues from broken opponents
Found 0 mismatches between UCI tests and tournament performance
